name: Pyotr Glebka
vita: Belarusian Soviet poet, playwright, translator, organizer of science. Academician of the Academy of Sciences of the Belorussian SSR (1957). Member of the USSR Writers' Union (1934).
birthPlace: Great Ussa village, now Uzda district, Minsk region

timelineData.text: He was born into a peasant family of Fedor and Tatiana Glebka.
He graduated from the seven-year school.
He studied at the Belarusian Pedagogical College.
He was the secretary of the magazine «Uzvyshshа» .
He graduated from the literary and linguistic department of the Belarusian State University.
He worked in the newspaper «The collective farmer of Belarus» , in the magazine «The Flame of Revolution» .
He served as a literary consultant at the Union of Writers of the Belorussian SSR.

Participant of the Great Patriotic War. During the war he worked in the editorial «For Soviet Belarus»  newspaper «For free Belarus» . He was published on the pages of the newspaper-poster «Smash the fascist skunk»  and the newspaper «Guerrilla baton» . Since 1942 - a member of the CPSU. In 1943-1945 - the editor of the publishing house of the Central Committee of the Communist Party(b)B «Soviet Belarus» , chief editor of the State Publishing House of the BSSR in Moscow.
He worked at the Institute of Literature, Language and Art of the Academy of Sciences of the Belorussian SSR.
He was in charge of the lexicography sector. He led the group on the compilation of the Russian-Belarusian Dictionary (1953).

Since 1957 - the Director of the Institute of Linguistics. In 1957–1969, Glebka headed the institute of art history, ethnography, and folklore of the Academy of Sciences of the Belorussian SSR. In 1966-1969 - Academician-Secretary of the Department of Social Sciences of the Academy of Sciences of the Belorussian SSR. He was elected deputy of the Supreme Soviet of the Belorussian SSR in 1955-1967. Participated in the sessions of the UN General Assembly (1955, 1956, 1957, 1964).
Pyotr Glebka died on the 18th of December in 1969. Buried at the Eastern Cemetery in Minsk.
